TITLE: Young conservatives send mixed messages on Trump at MAGA gathering
SUMMARY: Some attendees are talking about the former president more as a historical figure than the GOP's future presidential nominee.

TITLE: Germany is (still) a Huawei hotspot in Europe
SUMMARY: New study shows eight EU countries procured more than half of current 5G from Huawei from Chinese vendors.

TITLE: Judge strikes down California gun law modeled on Texas abortion measure
SUMMARY: The ruling could put the law on a trajectory to the Supreme Court.

TITLE: Lawmakers unveil government funding bill to stave off Friday shutdown
SUMMARY: The so-called omnibus would provide the military with $858 billion this fiscal year, while funding domestic programs at more than $772 billion.

TITLE: While advising Trump on judges, Conway sold her business to a firm with ties to judicial activist Leonard Leo
SUMMARY: The move adds to a growing picture of how groups associated with Leo helped advance the conservative legal agenda.

TITLE: Abortion roiled the midterms. Now it will define the presidential race.
SUMMARY: The Supreme Court’s June ruling erasing federal abortion rights has created a new litmus test in Republican presidential politics.

TITLE: Biden’s strategy for a far-right Israel: Lay it all on Bibi
SUMMARY: Incoming Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is expected to name figures with racist and other extreme views to top slots.

TITLE: ‘Lacking Credibility, Lacking Confidence From the People … Is Xi Xinping’s Greatest Vulnerability’
SUMMARY: Pro-democracy activist Wei Jingsheng in conversation with Matt Pottinger on where China goes from here.

TITLE: House GOP reckons with ‘candidate quality’ problem after midterms — and ahead of 2024
SUMMARY: The polarized country and nearly evenly split House means that a handful of unelectable candidates could tip the majority. It almost did in 2022.

TITLE: Boebert, Greene escalate war of words over McCarthy’s speaker push
SUMMARY: “She childishly threw me under the bus for a cheap sound bite,” Greene wrote.

TITLE: ‘When You Have No Credibility … You Are in Big Trouble’: A Chinese Dissident on Xi Jinping and the Future of Protest in China
SUMMARY: Pro-democracy activist Wei Jingsheng in conversation with Matt Pottinger on where China goes from here.

TITLE: The China-Taiwan dispute explained
SUMMARY: Beijing has vowed to bring Taiwan back under Chinese control — that could provoke a devastating conflict.

TITLE: Consumer bureau orders Wells Fargo to pay $3.7B to settle charges
SUMMARY: Wells Fargo agreed to the order without admitting or denying its findings.

TITLE: What’s in and what’s out of Congress' $1.7T spending bill
SUMMARY: From the lobster industry to TikTok to telehealth, the massive year-end government funding packages casts a wide net across public policy.

TITLE: First post-Roe spending bill includes no funding boost for family planning, angering groups
SUMMARY: With Republicans taking the House majority next year, progressives had framed the bill as a critical opportunity.

TITLE: Leahy departs with spending bill, plea for Senate 'defined not by soundbites'
SUMMARY: The Vermont Democrat has served in the body for nearly 48 years.

TITLE: Jeffries picks DelBene to lead House Dems' campaign arm in 2024
SUMMARY: DelBene had been part of a group of Democrats who pushed for the position to be appointed.

TITLE: DeSantis lays out ‘blueprint’ to elect more conservatives on school boards
SUMMARY: “For too long, these school boards have not reflected the values of the communities that they were supposedly elected to serve,” Ron DeSantis said.

TITLE: Consumer bureau orders Wells Fargo to pay $3.7B, in agency’s biggest fine
SUMMARY: The bank was charged with mismanaging auto loans, mortgages and deposit accounts.

TITLE: Jan. 6 committee formally accuses Donald Trump of 4 crimes
SUMMARY: The select panel held its final public meeting Monday afternoon and released the first components of its final report.
